decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy to further disrupt the opponent's hand and strategies. Additionally, the deck features lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's mana base and key creatures.

The deck focuses on aggressively ramping up mana and playing powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Frenzied Baloth to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes protection like Gaddock Teeg and Sylvan Safekeeper to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect key cards like Dark Depths. The deck utilizes Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time to tutor for specific creature cards and maintain consistency. With efficient mana ramp and a strong creature base, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle to generate large amounts of mana and ramp into powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes control elements like Collector Ouphe and Endurance to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck utilizes Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to tutor for key creatures, while also having access to removal and protection with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Quirion Ranger. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while building up a strong board presence to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt opponents while also leveraging the Stoneforge Mystic package to tutor for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice. Back to Basics punishes nonbasic lands, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and disruption. Quantum Riddler offers additional card selection and Ponder helps to filter draws. Overall, this deck aims to maintain board control, generate card advantage, and win through efficient beatdown with equipped creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle to disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your own win condition. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for equipment like Batterskull and Swords to Plowshares for removal. The addition of control elements like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds another layer of disruption and card advantage. Wasteland and Karakas are included to deal with problematic lands, while Brainstorm and Ponder provide card selection and deck manipulation. This deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful planning and resource management.

The deck focuses on quickly casting powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to apply pressure from early on in the game and close out matches quickly with big threats like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End. The inclusion of cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny further enhances the deck's aggro strategy by providing additional threats and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and other lands, facilitate the combo with cards like Crop Rotation and Ancient Stirrings, and ultimately bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul and Ulamog. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Trinisphere and Bojuka Bog to control the game and protect the combo. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and powerful spells while maintaining control of the game with various utility lands and disruptive spells.

The core strategy of this Deadguy Ale deck is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls while disrupting their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Snuff Out to handle threats from the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and The One Ring provide additional ways to close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck has access to land disruption with Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

The focus of this Bant Control deck is to effectively disrupt and control the opponent's gameplay while establishing card advantage and board presence. By using a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card draw effects, the deck aims to limit the opponent's actions and maintain control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide a win condition that can quickly close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck excels at outlasting opponents and grinding out victories through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the pace of the game through quick and disruptive plays, utilizing a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and countermagic. By pressuring the opponent while also disrupting their game plan, the deck aims to maintain tempo advantage and ultimately overwhelm the opponent before they can fully develop their board. Key cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize help to ensure the deck can adapt to various threats and maintain its aggressive tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining cards that provide tempo advantage with powerful threats like Nethergoyf and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuing to apply pressure. Additionally, the deck includes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy is to establish board control and maintain pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using lands as control tools, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. It also incorporates cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map to search for key lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale or Boseiju, Who Endures. Life from the Loam helps to recur lands from the graveyard, while cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through land interactions and powerful land-based combos.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Sinkhole and Wasteland while also pressuring opponents with efficient creatures like Barrowgoyf and Nethergoyf. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt opponents' game plans. The inclusion of powerful one-drop spells like Dark Ritual allows for explosive starts, while cards like Fatal Push provide removal for problematic threats. Palantr of Orthanc and undercity Sewers provide additional utility and strategic options for the player.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards using fast mana acceleration like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual to cast powerful spells like Necrodominance and Shadow of Mortality. It also uses cards like Boggart Trawler and Ancient Cellarspawn to continuously recur creatures from the graveyard. The goal is to create a strong board presence and overwhelming advantage through graveyard shenanigans and drain the opponent's life with cards like Soul Spike. The deck also runs disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect its game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Guide of Souls and Orcish Bowmasters while also disrupting the opponent's game plan through cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes some powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to generate additional value. With a mix of creature beatdown and hand disruption, it looks to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their strategy, leading to a fast and efficient win.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. It uses cards like Green Sun's Zenith, Crop Rotation, Knight of the Reliquary, and Elvish Reclaimer to quickly find and put Dark Depths into play. The deck also includes disruption cards like Collector Ouphe and Swords to Plowshares to control the game while setting up the combo. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Bojuka Bog, Wasteland, and Karakas to interact with the opponent's graveyard and creatures, providing versatility and protection for the combo strategy.
